title: Effect of light on sage plants

content.question:
Figure 1. Effect of light intensity and growth period on the rate of photosynthesis in sage plants. Error bars represent <math alttext="plus or minus 2 S E sub X bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>±</mo><msub><mtext>2SE</mtext><mover accent="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover></msub></math>.

Using light-filtering cloths, scientists exposed sage plants to four different light intensities. Half of the sage plants were exposed to light for <math alttext="60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn></math> days, while the other half were exposed to light for <math alttext="75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn></math> days. The rate of photosynthesis in each plant was then determined (Figure 1).

Which of the following statements best describes the data?

choices.label: At <math alttext="100%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mo>%</mo></math> light intensity, the rate of photosynthesis was higher in plants that were treated for <math alttext="60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn></math> days than in plants that were treated for <math alttext="75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn></math> days.
At <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></math> light intensity, the rate of photosynthesis was unaffected by an increase in treatment time.

At <math alttext="50%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mo>%</mo></math> light intensity, the rate of photosynthesis was the same as the rate of photosynthesis at <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></math> light intensity, regardless of the length of treatment time.

At <math alttext="25%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mo>%</mo></math> light intensity, the rate of photosynthesis was higher in plants treated for <math alttext="75" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn></math> days than it was in plants treated for <math alttext="60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn></math> days.

content.answer: At <math alttext="75%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn><mo>%</mo></math> light intensity, the rate of photosynthesis was unaffected by an increase in treatment time.

skill.text: 5.B: Use confidence intervals and error bars to estimate whether sample means are statistically different.
